items.title: Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin Finally Gets A Big Win With New Glenn — And SpaceX CEO Elon Musk Couldn't Help But Applaud
items.standfirst: On Thursday, Blue Origin's New Glenn launch and landing marked a turning point for Jeff Bezos' space ambitions — and also drew a warm nod from his biggest space rival, Elon Musk. New Glenn Lands Smoothly In One Of Blue Origin's Most Crucial Missions Yet Blue Origin successfully launched and landed…
items.content: On Thursday, Blue Origin's New Glenn launch and landing marked a turning point for Jeff Bezos' space ambitions — and also drew a warm nod from his biggest space rival, Elon Musk. New Glenn Lands Smoothly In One Of Blue Origin's Most Crucial Missions Yet Blue Origin successfully launched and landed…

items.title: Jeff Bezos's Blue Origin launches NASA Mars spacecraft on first New Glenn flight
items.standfirst: Jeff Bezos’s Blue Origin launched its New Glenn rocket on Thursday carrying NASA’s twin Mars-bound spacecraft, and in a major milestone successfully landed its booster for reuse. The launch, delayed for days by weather, marked only the second New Glenn flight and the first booster recovery by a company other than SpaceX.
items.content: Jeff Bezos’s Blue Origin launched its New Glenn rocket on Thursday carrying NASA’s twin Mars-bound spacecraft, and in a major milestone successfully landed its booster for reuse. The launch, delayed for days by weather, marked only the second New Glenn flight and the first booster recovery by a company other than SpaceX.

items.title: Blue Origin's New Glenn launches twin Mars probes
items.standfirst: Blue Origin, owned by Jeff Bezos, plans to challenge SpaceX with the powerful, partially reusable New Glenn rocket.
items.content: Blue Origin, owned by Jeff Bezos, plans to challenge SpaceX with the powerful, partially reusable New Glenn rocket.

items.title: Bezos' Blue Origin Successfully Lands Booster After Rocket Launch
items.standfirst: Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin launched its New Glenn rocket from Florida into space and successfully landed its first-stage booster rocket on a barge in the Atlantic Ocean. It's a historic mission. The rocket will send two spacecraft on a trajectory toward Mars. The booster landing is key to Blue Origin’s goal of making New Glenn partially reusable. Recovered boosters would be recycled for multiple launches. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin launched its New Glenn rocket from Florida into space and successfully landed its first-stage booster rocket on a barge in the Atlantic Ocean. It's a historic mission. The rocket will send two spacecraft on a trajectory toward Mars. The booster landing is key to Blue Origin’s goal of making New Glenn partially reusable. Recovered boosters would be recycled for multiple launches. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Bezos’s Blue Origin pulls off first landing of its largest reusable rocket

items.content: Launch of New Glenn is a boost for Amazon founder as he challenges Elon Musk’s grip on the space market

ai_summary: Blue Origin launched its New Glenn rocket from Florida into space, a historic mission.
The rocket will send two spacecraft on a trajectory toward Mars for a NASA mission.
The first-stage booster rocket successfully landed on a barge in the Atlantic Ocean.
This booster landing is key to Blue Origin's goal of making New Glenn reusable.
Recovered boosters would be recycled for multiple launches in the future.

items.content: At least 26 others have been injured in drone and missile strikes across Ukraine, officials say.

items.title: LIVE: Ukraine’s capital Kyiv comes under deadly Russian attack
items.standfirst: At least one death and more than 24 injuries have been reported in the city by the country's emergency services.
items.content: At least one death and more than 24 injuries have been reported in the city by the country's emergency services.

items.title: Explosions rock Kyiv as mayor reports ‘massive’ Russian strikes across the capital
items.standfirst: Almost every district of Ukraine’s capital Kyiv came under a “massive” attack on Friday, Mayor Vitaly Klitschko said. The attack killed at least one person and wounded at least 15 more, according to emergency services. Russia fired missiles and drones at energy, rail and other critical infrastructure, officials said, amid intensified strikes since its 2022 invasion.
items.content: Almost every district of Ukraine’s capital Kyiv came under a “massive” attack on Friday, Mayor Vitaly Klitschko said. items.title: ‘Massive enemy attack’: Russia pounds Ukraine’s Kyiv, killing one
items.standfirst: Ukrainian authorities say an elderly woman died in the overnight bombardment, which injured at least 24 others.
items.content: Ukrainian authorities say an elderly woman died in the overnight bombardment, which injured at least 24 others.

items.title: Russia attacks ‘every district’ of Kyiv, sparking fires across Ukrainian capital
items.standfirst: Pictures posted on social media showed different sites in flames and residents gathering in rubble-strewn streets outside apartment buildingsRussia unleashed a massive combined attack on Kyiv early Friday, sparking fires and scattering debris across many districts of the capital, mayor Vitali Klitschko said. At least 11 people were injured as emergency crews responded to multiple strikes, he said in a statement.Five people were hospitalised, including one man in critical condition and a pregnant woman, after a series of powerful explosions sounded in the city and air defences were activated. Continue reading...

items.title: Epstein said Trump "knew about the girls" in 2019 email, House Democrats say
items.standfirst: The three emails appear to be exchanges between convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, as well as the author Michael Wolff and Epstein.
items.content: The three emails appear to be exchanges between convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, as well as the author Michael Wolff and Epstein.

items.title: In newly released emails, Epstein suggests Donald Trump knew 'about the girls'
items.standfirst: Jeffrey Epstein suggested Donald Trump knew about his abuse and “spent hours” with a victim at his home, according to emails released by Democrats on Wednesday, raising fresh questions for the US president. Trump has denied any knowledge of Epstein’s sex-trafficking crimes and accused Democrats of political deflection.
items.content: Jeffrey Epstein suggested Donald Trump knew about his abuse and “spent hours” with a victim at his home, according to emails released by Democrats on Wednesday, raising fresh questions for the US president. Trump has denied any knowledge of Epstein’s sex-trafficking crimes and accused Democrats of political deflection.

items.title: House prepares to vote on releasing Epstein files
items.standfirst: The US House of Representative will vote next week on whether to require the Justice Department to publish all of its unclassified files on sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Democrats said the emails, including one in which Epstein said Trump spent hours at his house with one of his victims, raised troubling new questions about what Trump may have known. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell and Fraser Jackson report.
items.content: The US House of Representative will vote next week on whether to require the Justice Department to publish all of its unclassified files on sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Democrats said the emails, including one in which Epstein said Trump spent hours at his house with one of his victims, raised troubling new questions about what Trump may have known. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell and Fraser Jackson report.

items.title: US federal employees go back to work after longest shutdown in history
items.standfirst: Federal agencies have started reopening after the longest-ever US government shutdown... but it's likely the lingering effects of it will be felt for months. Scotland says it plans to issue its own government bonds, nicknaming them "kilts". And a Russian humanoid robot falls flat on its face.
items.content: Federal agencies have started reopening after the longest-ever US government shutdown... but it's likely the lingering effects of it will be felt for months. Scotland says it plans to issue its own government bonds, nicknaming them "kilts". And a Russian humanoid robot falls flat on its face.

items.title: The government shutdown is over, but not everything is back to normal
items.standfirst: President Trump signed a bill reopening the government Wednesday night, but it will take more than a day for some things to return to business as usual. We're tracking those here.
items.content: President Trump signed a bill reopening the government Wednesday night, but it will take more than a day for some things to return to business as usual. We're tracking those here.(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)

items.title: Israel receives body of one of the last four hostages held in Gaza
items.standfirst: Israel on Thursday received from the Red Cross the body of Meny Godard, one of the last four hostages held in Gaza, under a ceasefire deal with Hamas, the prime minister’s office said. Forensics confirmed Godard, 73, was killed during the October 7, 2023 Hamas-led attacks, it added.
items.content: Israel on Thursday received from the Red Cross the body of Meny Godard, one of the last four hostages held in Gaza, under a ceasefire deal with Hamas, the prime minister’s office said. Forensics confirmed Godard, 73, was killed during the October 7, 2023 Hamas-led attacks, it added.

items.content: In a letter, BBC said it had no plans to rebroadcast the documentary that was the basis of Trump's defamation claim.

items.title: BBC apologises to Trump over film edit but rejects defamation claim
items.standfirst: The BBC said on Thursday its chairman had apologised to US President Donald Trump for a misleading edit of one of his speeches, but denied it amounted to defamation. The broadcaster also said it was probing a possible second instance of a Trump speech edited in a misleading way.
items.content: The BBC said on Thursday its chairman had apologised to US President Donald Trump for a misleading edit of one of his speeches, but denied it amounted to defamation. The broadcaster also said it was probing a possible second instance of a Trump speech edited in a misleading way.

ai_summary: The BBC apologized to Donald Trump for a misleading edit.
The edit was from a documentary about Trump.
The BBC denied the edit amounted to defamation.
The broadcaster is investigating a second edit of Trump's speech.
The BBC has no plans to rebroadcast the documentary.

clusters.title: Trump administration targets European antifa groups as ‘global terrorists’
clusters.neutral_headline: US targets European antifa groups as ‘global terrorists’

items.title: Trump administration targets European antifa groups as ‘global terrorists’
items.standfirst: US State Department labelled four groups, from Germany, Greece and Italy, as 'specially designated global terrorists'.
items.content: US State Department labelled four groups, from Germany, Greece and Italy, as 'specially designated global terrorists'.

items.title: US designates four European anti-fascist groups as terrorist threats
items.standfirst: State department claims groups in Germany, Italy and Greece ‘conspiring to undermine foundations of western civilization’The US state department has announced that it will designate four European self-described anti-fascist groups as Foreign Terrorist Organisations, as the Trump administration broadens its campaign against what it portrays as an international wave of leftist violence.In a public statement on Thursday, the state department said it would designate Antifa Ost in Germany, the Italy-based International Revolutionary Front, and two organisations in Greece – Armed Proletarian Justice and Revolutionary Class Self Defense – as “Specially Designated Global Terrorists … conspiring to undermine the foundations of Western Civilization through their brutal attacks”. Continue reading...
items.content: State department claims groups in Germany, Italy and Greece ‘conspiring to undermine foundations of western civilization’The US state department has announced that it will designate four European self-described anti-fascist groups as Foreign Terrorist Organisations, as the Trump administration broadens its campaign against what it portrays as an international wave of leftist violence.In a public statement on Thursday, the state department said it would designate Antifa Ost in Germany, the Italy-based International Revolutionary Front, and two organisations in Greece – Armed Proletarian Justice and Revolutionary Class Self Defense – as “Specially Designated Global Terrorists … conspiring to undermine the foundations of Western Civilization through their brutal attacks”. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The US State Department labeled four groups as "specially designated global terrorists".
The groups are from Germany, Greece, and Italy.
The State Department claims the groups undermine Western civilization.
The Trump administration is broadening its campaign against leftist violence.
The groups are self-described anti-fascist organizations.

clusters.title: Trump writes to Israeli president calling for Netanyahu pardon
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump writes to Israeli president calling for Netanyahu pardon

items.title: Trump writes to Israeli president calling for Netanyahu pardon
items.standfirst: Isaac Herzog can pardon convicted criminals in some circumstances, but cases against Israeli PM are ongoingDonald Trump has repeated a request to Israel’s president, Isaac Herzog, for a pardon for Benjamin Netanyahu, who is on trial in three separate corruption cases.The Israeli prime minister has repeatedly denied any wrongdoing in the ongoing court cases. No rulings have been delivered, and his supporters have dismissed the trials as politically motivated. Continue reading...

No rulings have been delivered, and his supporters have dismissed the trials as politically motivated. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump asks Israeli president to 'fully pardon' Netanyahu in corruption trial

items.content: Donald Trump has sent a letter to the Israeli president urging him to "fully pardon" Benjamin Netanyahu in his long-running corruption trial.
